statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ -7 \\ -9 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ -2 \\ 4 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ 0 \\ -1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 12 \\ 6 \\ -12 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 26 \\ 12 \\ -25 \\ 7 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 18 \\ 12 \\ -21 \\ 3 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ -7 \\ -9 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ -2 \\ 4 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ 0 \\ -1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 12 \\ 6 \\ -12 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 26 \\ 12 \\ -25 \\ 7 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 18 \\ 12 \\ -21 \\ 3 \end{array}\right].
